They operate five women's shelters with a total of 228 places for women and children. For women who do not wish to reside in a shelter but still need help, they offer an outpatient counseling center providing anonymous and free consultations. The counseling center employs women from the fields of social work, psychology, and education, as well as lawyers and a doctor. Their principles include supporting women, advocating for abused women and children, providing anonymity, offering unbureaucratic support regardless of nationality or documentation, and promoting women's self-determination. The organization is financed by the City of Vienna, the Federal Chancellery, the Federal Ministry of Justice, and the ams Wien.

description: Silberhorn Gruppe specializes in industrial cleaning machines and sheet metal processing. Their core business involves the development and production of comprehensive solutions for cleaning systems and high-pressure water jet deburring technology. They also manufacture individual parts and system components using laser cutting and subsequent processing in their sheet metal technology division. Their product range includes various cleaning systems such as small systems, continuous flow cleaning systems (including Multiline and LAS models), container and plastic container cleaning systems, immersion systems, rotary tables (RTM and RTM Ministar), chamber cleaning systems (Silberhorn MWS 6 and MWS 4), Multijet LC, robot cells (REZ), special systems, and UltraFine-DiP. Silberhorn is expanding its sales network in Europe, partnering with companies in the Czech Republic, Slovakia, and Sweden. They participate in trade fairs like parts2clean. The company employs 200 people and was founded in 1989, having installed 1609 systems and achieved 700 tons of CO2 savings per year with a 1250 kWp PV system. They are located in Lupburg, Germany.

description: GRESSEL AG is a Swiss company specializing in clamping technology and automation solutions for CNC machining. With nearly 100 years of experience, GRESSEL offers a range of products including 5-axis clamps (SC5X, grepos-5X), centric clamps (C2.0, C3), machine vices (gripos, grefors, SC2.0, S2), zero-point clamping systems (gre4doc, gredoc), multiple clamps (D2, M1), and electro-spanners (grepos-5X-E). They also provide automation solutions for pallets and workpieces, including hydraulic and R-C2 systems. GRESSEL's products are designed to optimize manufacturing processes, reduce workpiece manufacturing costs, and increase production capacity in CNC machining. They offer both standard products and customized clamping solutions. The company emphasizes precision, innovation, and customer satisfaction, offering services such as on-site consultations and clamping device testing. GRESSEL aims to help customers maximize the spindle running times of their machines and improve overall productivity by addressing issues like insufficient multi-clamping options, lack of workpiece automation, long changeover times, and inflexible clamping technology. They serve various industries requiring metalworking and CNC manufacturing solutions.

description: watttron is a company focused on optimizing manufacturing processes through its disruptive technology platform. It aims to provide customers with a comprehensive understanding and control over their thermal processes to achieve high quality and maximum efficiency. description: ASFINAG (Autobahnen- und Schnellstraßen-Finanzierungs-Aktiengesellschaft) is an Austrian corporation responsible for the financing, planning, construction, maintenance, and operation of the country's autobahn (highway) and expressway network. Their core business revolves around tolling and traffic management on these roads. ASFINAG offers various tolling options including vignettes (both digital and adhesive) for vehicles up to 3.5 tons, and the GO-Maut system for vehicles exceeding 3.5 tons, utilizing a GO-Box for automated toll collection. They also manage Streckemaut (section tolls) for specific high-cost infrastructure like tunnels. The company's activities encompass traffic safety initiatives, including the ASFINAG Verkehrssicherheitsprogramm 2030 aimed at making Austrian highways the safest in Europe, tunnel safety measures, and campaigns promoting safe driving practices. ASFINAG is also involved in construction and maintenance projects, including noise protection measures, and provides parking and rest facilities along the highways, including E-Ladestationen (electric charging stations) and Lkw Stellplätze (truck parking). They provide real-time traffic information through webcams and traffic reports, and offer route planning services. ASFINAG also issues bonds under its EMTN program, guaranteed by the Republic of Austria, to finance its operations and infrastructure projects. The company is committed to sustainability and innovation, aiming to be a key player in Austria's climate transition. They offer a customer service chat and a service center available 24/7.

description: ETS Efficient Technical Solutions GmbH is a German company that provides comprehensive building technology services. As a full-service provider for technical building equipment (TGA), ETS offers concept design, planning, execution, maintenance, and repair services from a single source. In addition to its core TGA business, ETS specializes in areas such as test bench technology (Prüfstandtechnik), energy technology (Energietechnik), and automation technology (Automatisierungstechnik). The company delivers integrated engineering services with expertise in technical building equipment and plant engineering. ETS is a subsidiary of the Elevion Group, a market leader in mechanical and electrical building technology in Germany with approximately 3,300 employees across over 60 locations. ETS's services include heating technology, sanitation technology, refrigeration and air conditioning technology, electrical engineering, and measurement, control, and regulation technology. They also design, construct, operate, and optimize decentralized energy generation plants for commercial, industrial, and municipal clients. ETS also offers motor and system test stands for thermodynamic and mechanical function testing, and climate chambers and environmental simulations in collaboration with Rudolf Fritz GmbH. In collaboration with HERMOS AG and Rudolf Fritz GmbH, ETS provides customized automation and IT solutions. Founded in 2013 in Schnaittenbach, ETS has over 350 employees and generates around 150 million euros in total revenue in 2023. They have over 8 international locations and 25 trainees.

description: ENTECCOgroup is an environmental technology company specializing in air pollution control solutions for various industries, including aluminum, asphalt, chemicals, food, energy, automotive, foundries, wood, steel, metals, and stone/earth processing. They offer a range of products and services, including engineering, 3D planning/CAD, electrical and control technology, laser scanning, static calculations, flow simulation, technical calculations, and virtual reality applications. ENTECCOgroup offers comprehensive services, including service concepts, service contracts, spare parts, and full-service maintenance. The company has multiple locations in Germany, the USA, Austria, Poland, and India, along with international partners. Their brands include GARANT-Filter, LHS Clean Air Systems, Turbofilter, Advanced Air Purification, INFRA>PROCESS Energy, ENTECCO filter technology, and BMD GARANT. ENTECCOgroup emphasizes energy-efficient and customized solutions, focusing on dust extraction and exhaust gas purification systems. They aim to provide optimal equipment costs, low energy consumption, heat recovery, and reduced operating and maintenance costs. The company also highlights its experience of over 60 years in building complex flue gas cleaning systems. Customer testimonials emphasize the conceptual unique selling points, operational advantages, energy efficiency, and reliability of their filter systems.

description: Gebrüder Lödige Maschinenbau GmbH, founded in 1938 and based in Paderborn, Germany, is a leading global provider of process equipment and subsystems for various process engineering applications. The company is renowned as the inventor of the Ploughshare® mixer. Lödige offers comprehensive solutions for mixing, granulation, coating, drying, and reacting processes. Lödige provides both horizontal and vertical mixers, contact dryers, vacuum dryers (such as the DRUVATHERM® vacuum paddle dryer), reactors, coaters, and granulators. They offer customized solutions for battery production, construction material processing, chemical treatments, cosmetic manufacturing, plastics and rubber processing, metallurgical applications, food processing, pharmaceutical production adhering to international standards, polysaccharide production, and environmental technology applications. Lödige also provides services such as a service finder, customer service (including maintenance, global support, and training), a technical center for product development, engineering services, explosion protection, pressure vessel manufacturing, and used machinery. The company emphasizes quality, precision, and reliability, with manufacturing based in Germany. Lödige's mission is to provide high-quality subsystems and services for process engineering applications, focusing on core industries and customer proximity to ensure positive company development. They offer full-service support, including process development, engineering, manufacturing, and service, with a large number of patents and delivered machines demonstrating their experience in customer-oriented system solutions. The company operates globally with over 500 employees, supported by a network of subsidiaries, technical offices, and representatives.

description: Cubonic GmbH is a technology company focused on redefining last-mile transportation through autonomous driving and connected ecosystems. Their vision is centered around an integrated eLCV (electric Light Commercial Vehicle) concept. The company offers technology-based solutions aimed at creating a greener future for last-mile transportation. Their solution involves three business pillars: 'THE ROBOT' - a flexible automation platform, 'THE TOOL' - bespoke electric vehicles, and 'THE LINK' - a customizable fleet and vehicle management system. Cubonic targets the specific needs and challenges of last-mile delivery. The company was founded in February 2022 and has a team of 85 experienced employees. They are developing Advanced Prototypes (APTs), with physical vehicle builds starting in December 2023 and build completion expected in September 2024. Cubonic emphasizes inclusivity within its team. description: Krämer+Grebe is a German family-owned company with over 100 years of experience, specializing in high-tech foundry tools and model construction. They are a global market leader in providing solutions for the foundry industry, focusing on the development and manufacturing of complete equipment and tools for casting processes. Their core offerings include molds (Kokillen), die casting forms (Druckgussformen), models and core tools (Modelle + Kernformwerkzeuge), prototype components (Prototypenkomponenten), special machines and devices (Sondermaschinen und -geräte), and core drying technology (Kerntrocknungstechnologie). The company emphasizes close collaboration with customers throughout the development process, from initial concept to series production. Krämer+Grebe provides a comprehensive service portfolio, including development partnerships, mobile task forces, maintenance and repair, process and tool optimization, and other services. They act as development partners, particularly for new challenges in areas like electromobility, offering expertise in selecting appropriate casting methods. Their services include nominal data setup, component development, tool layout, concept development, and parametric tool design. They utilize a "Simultaneous Engineering" approach to improve the development process and save time. The company also offers mobile teams for on-site support, maintenance, and repairs, often within 24 hours. They provide individual maintenance and repair plans, with a logistics network for quick turnaround. Krämer+Grebe's expertise extends to optimizing tools and processes, drawing on their extensive experience and knowledge management. They use modern analysis and simulation tools to advise customers on cost, quality, sustainability, and environmental impact. They are specialists in the development and manufacture of high-tech tools and model equipment, offering complete facilities for foundry needs. Their Kokillen (molds) are suitable for highly stressed cast parts with complex geometries, and they offer various types, including gravity die casting, low-pressure die casting, counter pressure casting, and tilt casting. They also provide die casting forms for aluminum and magnesium parts, including those for mega- and giga-castings, and offer support with filling and solidification simulations. The company constructs models and core tools for small and large series production, and they have developed a patented technology for improved core drying, particularly for inorganic core production.

They develop solutions for sound and vibration isolation in rail transport and for machinery. description: VERMES Microdispensing GmbH, founded over 75 years ago and headquartered in Holzkirchen, Germany, is a high-tech innovator specializing in microdispensing technology. Originally a specialist ink manufacturer, the company revolutionized the field in 2001 with the introduction of the world's first contact-free piezo-based dispensing systems. Today, VERMES is a world leader in the design and manufacture of innovative microdispensing concepts and systems for adhesives, silicones, greases, solvents, solder pastes, cell suspensions and other fluids. Their Micro Dispensing Systems (MDS) are based on contact-free Piezo or Dynamic Shockwave Technology (DST). These systems are essential for various manufacturing processes across industries such as microelectronics, semiconductors, consumer electronics, LED/LCD, medical technology, pharmaceutics, and automotive. VERMES's systems are known for their precision, reliability, and speed, dispensing viscous droplets in micro-, nano-, and sub-nanoliter quantities at high frequencies, with valves operating at theoretical frequencies exceeding 3000 Hz. The company offers solutions for solder paste dispensing, hot melt dispensing, high-frequency dispensing, special machinery solutions, and medical solutions. Their product lines include Piezo Xtreme 2 (PX2) based Systems, Piezo based Systems, and Dynamic Shockwave Technology (DST) based Systems. They also offer accessories like DVS (Drop Volume System), media supply, tappets, and nozzle inserts. VERMES serves a vast range of industries, including automotive, consumer electronics, semiconductor, optoelectronics, photovoltaics, medical/pharmaceutical, precision mechanics, RFID, and industrial electronics. They provide market-specific solutions tailored to individual customer needs, including thorough analysis of dispensing applications, technical consultation and support, individual operator training, and maintenance services. VERMES has subsidiaries in China, the USA, South Korea, Malaysia, India, and Japan, and is committed to providing customers worldwide with the best technology and services to improve production throughput, enhance quality, and reduce manufacturing costs.

description: NOKERA AG is a technology-based platform focused on serial manufacturing with wood, aiming to transform the construction industry and promote the energy transition in the building sector. They plan and build high-quality, sustainable houses serially to create affordable housing, targeting the German building sector's climate neutrality. Over 80% of their sustainable buildings are manufactured in-house. Their offerings include multi-family houses, micro apartments, point houses for densification, temporary accommodations, and public buildings made of wood. They also provide serial renovation services using prefabricated wooden roof trusses and facades, as well as interior solutions like kitchens and bathrooms. NOKERA integrates renewable energy systems like heat pumps and photovoltaics into their buildings, aiming for energy-positive buildings and offering energy management services. They utilize a digitized, serial construction process to create resource-efficient and affordable housing. The company emphasizes the use of wood as a renewable and recyclable resource, reducing CO2 emissions and energy consumption. NOKERA has been recognized with the German Sustainability Award 2025 and the TOP 100 seal for innovation. They use BIM models and data to digitalize construction and renovation, with a digital twin for each project. Approximately 80% of components are produced in their vertically integrated production sites, enabling efficient construction in under three months. They primarily use PEFC-certified wood from Germany, reducing waste and ensuring buildings are up to 95% recyclable. Their buildings meet KfW 40 QNG standards and can be DGNB-Gold certified. NOKERA operates the NOKERA Green Factory in Stegelitz near Magdeburg, with a capacity of up to 30,000 residential units per year. They are also committed to ESG principles and have been recognized as a top ESG company. description:
Neusoft Technology Solutions GmbH (NTS), the European headquarters of Neusoft Corporation, is a software company specializing in automotive embedded software development. Neusoft Corporation, founded in 1991 and based in China, has a global presence with nearly 20,000 employees and an extensive R&D, sales, and service network. NTS offers a broad portfolio ranging from IP products to engineering services, focusing on navigation, cockpit systems, connectivity, and testing solutions for the automotive industry. 

In navigation, Neusoft provides off-the-shelf solutions, navigation cores, cloud functions and services, map compilation (including an NDS compiler for challenging markets like China and Japan), ADAS support (ISA, eHorizon, ADASIS v2 & v3), and augmented reality applications. For cockpit systems, they offer full-stack solutions for infotainment systems and instrument clusters, including IVI software and hardware development. Their connectivity solutions include TCU hardware platforms (like the Neusoft T-Box with integrated smart antenna), V2X solutions, backend cloud service platform development, and application development for embedded, mobile, web, and service apps. Neusoft also provides testing services, including manual, automatic, field, and test driving, to ensure user experience and system functionality. 

Neusoft's solutions include OneCoreGo (a modifiable off-the-shelf solution with connected services and worldwide database), Augmented Reality solutions (for navigation and ADAS warnings), OpenStreetMap-based database solutions, Nav-ADAS (eHorizon, high accurate positioning), Intelligent Cockpit System (dual OS concept, hypervisor technology, ADAS/AVM/V2X/TCU interfaces, 3rd party app support), T-Box (next-generation communication domain controller), and Cloud Platform (connecting vehicle and mobile devices with OEM vehicle service and connectivity cloud). They also offer GIS data and scenario management for traffic sign recognition, road hazard detection, and speed limits.

description: KEIL Befestigungstechnik GmbH is a German company specializing in undercut anchor technology for facade cladding. Their core offering is the KEIL undercut system, which provides a secure and concealed fixing method for various facade materials like ceramics, fiber cement, and glass fiber concrete. The system utilizes a specialized drilling technique to create a precise borehole on the back of the facade panels, into which the KEIL undercut anchor is inserted, ensuring a form-fitting and tension-free connection. This technology allows for creative architectural designs without compromising safety or aesthetics. KEIL emphasizes the reliability, durability, and versatility of their system, highlighting its ability to hold over 600 different materials and its ease of installation. They also focus on sustainability by using stainless steel A4 in their anchors, which reduces the number of anchors needed per panel due to their high load-bearing capacity. The company operates as a family business and manufactures its products in Engelskirchen, Germany, emphasizing quality and precision. Their system ensures a non-visible fixing, maintaining the aesthetic appeal of the facade.

description: Plarad is a German company specializing in innovative bolting technology and torque tools. Established in 1962, Plarad develops and manufactures electric, hydraulic, and pneumatic bolting systems and torque wrenches. Their products cater to various industries, including wind energy, power plants, oil & gas, transportation, mechanical engineering, steel construction, and construction machinery. Plarad offers a comprehensive range of products, including battery-powered torque wrenches (DA2power, DA2docu, DA2control, DA2safety, DA2motion), electric torque wrenches (DE1docu, DE1docuplus), pneumatic torque wrenches, hydraulic torque wrenches (MX-EC / MSX, Flanschschrauber FSX K-Serie, Hydraulikschrauber LT HPR), tensioning cylinders (Einstufiger Spannzylinder PSE, Mehrstufige Spannzylinder PSD, PST, PSQ), and hydraulic aggregates (XA1power, XE1 eco, XE1 power, XE1 docu, XE1 control, Dual XE1 docu, Dual XE1 control, TXE1 docu, TXE1 eco), manual hand pumps and force multipliers, and related accessories. They also provide digital solutions and a rental service. Plarad emphasizes customer service, offering maintenance, repair, mobile service, maintenance contracts, and training through the PLARAD® Academy. The company highlights its commitment to quality and innovation in bolting solutions, particularly for demanding applications like wind turbine construction and maintenance. Plarad's DA2control is a battery-operated torque tool focused on efficiency, precision, and flexibility, featuring one-handed operation, direct torque and angle input, and over-the-air updates. They also offer lifting devices (HV1power) for safe handling of hydraulic bolt tensioners in wind turbine applications.

description: BBV Systems GmbH specializes in providing innovative systems and processes for the construction industry, focusing on pre-stressed concrete applications. Their core business encompasses structural engineering, geotechnical engineering, and the repair and reinforcement of structures like bridges and parking garages. They offer a range of services including strand and bar post-tensioning for structural engineering and building construction, geotechnical anchoring systems for foundations and slope stabilization, and structural repair and strengthening solutions. BBV Systems caters to infrastructure projects and building construction globally, offering products that meet modern engineering requirements. They develop, plan, manufacture, and install systems, including strand and bar post-tensioning, temporary and permanent anchors, and pile anchoring. Their systems have national and European approvals and are used worldwide. BBV Systems emphasizes technical expertise, material availability, and flexibility. They develop their systems and procedures, conduct testing, and obtain regulatory approvals. They offer solutions for pre-stressed concrete structures, including bridges, flat slabs, containers, and wind power towers, with national and European approvals for both internal and external pre-stressing of wind power towers. They also provide geotechnical systems like the Multibond-Staffelanker. The company is a subsidiary of Implenia and is active throughout Europe and beyond, including Asia through BBV Systems Thailand, serving large international construction groups and regional construction companies. BBV Systems emphasizes innovation and holds patents for its developments. They offer class 1 grade steel for post-tensioning applications.

description: HEDELIUS Maschinenfabrik, founded in 1967 and based in Germany, is a manufacturer of CNC machining centers and automation solutions. The company's core business revolves around developing and producing vertical CNC travelling column machining centers, recognized across Europe for their precision, stability, and reliability. Their product range includes 3-axis, 4-axis, and 5-axis machining centers, catering to the production of individual parts, small series, and medium series. These machines are utilized in machine engineering, vehicle construction, and tool manufacturing. HEDELIUS offers three main series of machining centers: ACURA (compact 5-axis high-performance machining centers with a rotary/swivel table), TILTENTA (versatile machining centers with a continuously swiveling main spindle and integrated NC rotary table), and FORTE (vertical 3-axis machining centers with a travelling column design). The company also provides automation solutions, including pallet automation, workpiece automation, hybrid automation, linear linking, and tool automation, offering both in-house and third-party solutions. HEDELIUS serves a diverse range of industries, including agricultural machinery, aerospace, automotive, packaging technology, process engineering, energy and environmental technology, medical technology, shipbuilding, rail vehicles, and educational institutions. Their machines are equipped with modern control technology from SIEMENS or HEIDENHAIN. HEDELIUS emphasizes quality 'Made in Germany' and aims to enhance the efficiency and profitability of its customers' manufacturing processes. They offer options such as measurement systems, workspace partitions, zero-point clamping technology, integrated NC rotary tables, CNC controls, cooling and lubrication systems, cleaning technology, liquid-cooled motor spindles, door automation, custom paint finishes, and chip presses. Over 3,000 manufacturing companies in Europe rely on HEDELIUS Zerspanungslösungen.

description: Tark Thermal Solutions (formerly Laird Thermal Systems) is a global provider of thermal management solutions. The company designs, develops, and manufactures a comprehensive range of products, including liquid cooling systems, pumps, thermoelectric coolers and assemblies, and temperature controllers, as well as custom solutions. These products cater to demanding applications across various markets, including medical, analytical, industrial, telecommunications, data centers, optoelectronics, and transportation. Tark Thermal Solutions offers services such as design, manufacturing, prototyping, service & support, and software testing. description: IBT GmbH is a German company specializing in industrial heating solutions using infrared technology. Their main offerings include a range of industrial furnaces and ovens, including high-temperature furnaces, vacuum and protective gas furnaces, tube furnaces, circulating air ovens, retort furnaces, and various infrared technology-based ovens and systems. Specifically, they offer ContiLine-DRY (infrared continuous dryer), ContiLine-HEAT (infrared continuous oven), ThermoLine-DRY (infrared drying oven with drawers), infrared systems, and infrared heaters. These solutions are designed for applications such as drying water-based varnishes, evaporating solvents, cross-linking solvent lacquers, melting and curing powder coatings, and drying food. IBT GmbH customizes the size, heating power, and control systems of their equipment to meet specific process requirements. Their equipment incorporates features like Siemens PLC, industrial PC or controller modules for measurement, control, and regulation, contactless product temperature measurement, and safety features like forced shutdown with warning signals. They offer automation of the heating process through recipes. The company's products are used in various industries, including plastics processing (heating thermoplastics, annealing thermosets, laminating plastics, shrinking plastics), food processing (preheating, baking, caramelizing, browning, and keeping warm), and heat treatment of components to adjust properties like hardness and strength. IBT GmbH also provides automation (MCR) solutions and engineering services related to heat transfer and infrared radiation. Their ContiLine-DRY series features temperatures up to 400°C, while the ContiLine-HEAT series can reach up to 800°C. The ThermoLine-DRY series is a mobile infrared station with drawers, offering flexibility for different production sites.

description: Pilz und Partner ZT GmbH is an engineering firm based in Austria, specializing in civil engineering and related services. Their core business revolves around providing planning and execution support for construction projects, emphasizing sustainability and contributing to a high quality of life through thoughtful design. The firm's main offerings include structural engineering (statics), building physics (heat, moisture, and sound protection), acting as a review engineer (Prüfingenieur) for structural calculations, comprehensive planning services, review statics, room acoustics and noise protection, facade building physics, and BIM + 3D planning. They aim to minimize energy and resource consumption and reduce environmental impact throughout a building's lifecycle. Pilz und Partner's services target a broad range of construction projects, as evidenced by their portfolio, which includes residential buildings, commercial properties, educational institutions, and infrastructure projects. They emphasize a holistic approach, integrating various planning disciplines to ensure efficient coordination and high-quality results. description: SOCO ENGINEERS GmbH is a global automotive supplier providing computer-aided engineering (CAE), information technology (IT), and artificial intelligence/machine learning (AI/ML) services. They offer expertise in numerical simulations, crashworthiness, occupant safety, pedestrian safety, NVH (Noise, Vibration, and Harshness), strength & durability, and DOE (Design of Experiments) & optimization. Their IT services include web and app development, enterprise development, data management, and HPC (High-Performance Computing) management. In AI/ML, they offer deep learning, big data analytics, pattern recognition, parameter optimization, quantifying risk, and convolutional neural networks. SOCO also offers a Smart SDM system called SIMuSPACE with a Workflow Manager, designed by CAE engineers for CAE engineers. They focus on helping business partners accelerate their journey to adapting AI and Data Analytics to become smart digital enterprises. They provide consulting services to optimize processes and introduce novel techniques. SOCO ENGINEERS believes in engineering success with technology, delivering solutions to customers with process automation and increased productivity. They have qualified engineers working in multiple countries.

description: HJS Emission Technology GmbH & Co. KG is a German company based in Menden, Sauerland, specializing in emission technology for over 40 years. Their core business involves developing sustainable solutions for clean mobility, offering products and services for industry, trade, and workshops. They operate in two main segments: Passenger Vehicle/Aftermarket, catering to cars, light commercial vehicles, and motorhomes, and Heavy Duty/Industry, providing modular exhaust aftertreatment systems for mobile and stationary engines. Their product range includes particulate filter systems, electronics & sensor technology, catalytic converter systems, combination systems, exhaust pipes & silencers, and spare parts. HJS emphasizes environmental and health protection as guiding principles, driving their innovation in emission technologies for the automotive industry. They offer SCRT (Selective Catalytic Reduction Technology) systems, particularly for retrofitting inland vessels to meet stringent emission requirements, highlighting a modular design for flexible adaptation to various engine types and installation scenarios. The company also focuses on providing cost-effective and sustainable alternatives to complete engine replacements, enabling compliance with Stage V emission standards and offering benefits like Green Award points. HJS collaborates with other companies, such as Lhoist-Kalkwerk Hönnetal, on industrial efficiency projects. Recently, DEUTZ AG became a new shareholder in HJS Emission Technology.

description: KREISEL Electric is an Austrian company specializing in advanced battery technology and electrification solutions. As a battery technology pioneer, they offer modular high-voltage battery systems designed for a wide range of applications including commercial vehicles, off-highway equipment, marine vessels, and motorsport. Their patented KREISEL Electric Immersion Cooling Technology is a key differentiator, providing superior thermal management for enhanced battery lifetime, safety, and performance. Their product portfolio includes battery systems (like KBP63, KBE.24.450S, KBE.39.750S/C, and KBE.59.750M) and high-power charging solutions, including the CHIMERO series. KREISEL targets various sectors, including commercial, off-highway, and marine industries, offering solutions that meet stringent safety and performance requirements. The company emphasizes sustainability and has partnered with BASF for sustainable battery recycling. KREISEL Electric is part of the John Deere family, leveraging their combined expertise to drive the future of e-mobility, particularly in off-highway equipment electrification. description: SmartCardia is a company focused on cardiology and remote patient monitoring solutions. Their main product is the SmartCardia 7L Patch, a 7/14 day patch that provides real-time 7-Lead ECG and vitals monitoring, complemented by a SaaS platform. The patch is designed for outpatient cardiac telemetry and has received FDA clearance. It measures ECG, respiration, SpO2, and activity, and uses cloud-based arrhythmia detection. SmartCardia's technology includes SmartNeuralNet, a machine learning technology for detecting cardiac arrhythmia events and patient deterioration, based on millions of ECG segments annotated by cardiologists. The system transmits all 7 ECG leads in near real-time to the cloud, allowing for immediate action by clinicians. The solution supports remote transition from Holter to Extended Holter or Mobile Cardiac Telemetry. The system transmits 100% of the ECG data and offers automated analysis. The patch is cable-free, skin-friendly, and waterproof, and can be worn for up to 14 days. It supports Mobile Cardiac Telemetry, Remote Patient Monitoring, Holter, Extended Holter, and Event Monitoring. The sensor is re-usable and doesn't require charging. The platform is designed for cardiac screening, post-discharge monitoring, and long-term remote patient monitoring. SmartCardia highlights enhanced operational, financial, and clinical efficiency through automated analysis, re-usable devices, and accurate arrhythmia diagnosis. They serve hospitals and work with electrophysiologists.

description: Karl Schmidt Spedition GmbH is a family-owned company based in Heilbronn, Germany, that has evolved into a leading bulk logistics service provider in Europe. With 2,500 employees across 49 locations worldwide, the Schmidt Group offers comprehensive services for the transport, storage, and handling of bulk goods. The company also plans and constructs logistics facilities for loose bulk materials. Schmidt Group manages over 1,000 transport orders daily, along with storage and customized special orders. Their core business revolves around transport and logistics services using silo trucks and silo containers, including import and export handling. They offer tailored logistics solutions and operate a large network of logistics centers in Europe for plastics. Schmidt provides a full service chain from production to processing, including silo vehicle interior cleaning, repair, and maintenance at their workshops. Specialized services include optical granulate sorting, mobile granulate throwing, homogenizing, mechanical sieving, electronic metal separation, product drying, vacuum extraction, and wind sifting. A proprietary, modern forwarding software supports users across various departments. The company emphasizes quality in bulk transport through cleaning services and offers specialized services for granulate processing.
